info.name: Development API Documentation v1
info.description:
# Momo Etude premium insurance subscription ## APIs access privileges for back office The privileges on this platform are: CREATE, READ, UPDATE and DELETE - ADMINISTRATOR: This role is reserve to Kangson-e staff - DEVELOPER: This role is reserve to Kangson-e staff - PRUBELIFE_STAFF: This role is reserve to Prudential Belife staff. Legend: ❌ : Can't access the resource ❎ : Is not required to access the resource ☑️：Is needed to access the resource. _**Note:**_ - _**It is important to note that you can access the resource if you have at least one of the above roles with**_ ☑️_**.**_ - `/ussd` routes are not concerned by the back office | API path | AUTHENTICATION | ADMINISTRATOR (ROLE) | DEVELOPER
(ROLE) | **PRUBELIFE**
STAFF (ROLE) | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `POST /auth/login` | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `DELETE /auth/logout` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /customers` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /customers/:id` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `PUT /customers/:id` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ☑️ | | `GET /beneficiaries` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /beneficiaries/:id` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `PUT /beneficiaries/:id` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ☑️ | | `GET /insurances` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /insurances/:id` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `POST /insurances` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ☑️ | | `PUT /insurances/:id` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ☑️ | | `GET /subscriptions` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /subscriptions/:id` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /premiums` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /premiums/:id` | ☑️ | ❎ | ❎ | ❎ | | `GET /users` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | | `GET /users/:id` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | | `POST /users` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ❌ | | `PUT /users/:id` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ❌ | | `DELETE /users/:id` | ☑️ | ☑️ | ❌ | ❌ |

item.name: Logs in and returns the authentication cookie

response.name: Successfully authenticated. The session ID is returned in a cookie named `connect.sid`. You need to include this cookie in subsequent requests.

item.name: ussd
Read an insurance and it's monthly premium fees

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the insurance

response.name: The insurance and its monthly premium fees corresponding to the provided `InsuranceId`

response.name:
The customer has no contract and it's ok to proceed with a subscription. There are two cases:
 1- Customer is already know of our service but his payment at the subscription failed or timeout
 2- Customer is unknow of our service

response.name:
This return all the customer's subscriptions on the platform for you to verify the eligibility before payment.
 1. If the customer has 3 subscriptions deny creating a new one
 2. If the customer submitted a subscription with the same beneficiary deny creating a new one
 3. If the customer do not enter the above cases allow creating a new one

item.description: # **Subscription** There is a need to verify that customer does not have a valid (payed) subscription. _**Customer account verification:**_ `GET /api/v1/ussd/customers/{phoneNumber}` After verification, you can send subscription `POST /api/v1/ussd/subscriptions` # Premium payment To proceed with a payment, I believe you need to display the custome's contracts. For that use `GET /api/v1/ussd/contracts/{phoneNumber}`. There might also be the case where the customer is not up to date of all his/her premium payments. (This will be handle in the future, with the introductions of contract consultation).
